alert.note: Alert for Jackson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Jackson County in Western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 AM EDT, As much as 4 inches of rain has fallen this morning within the headwaters of the Tuckasegee River. Be wary of high water conditions, rising stream and river levels, and possibly developing out of bank conditions from the headwaters downstream toward Cullowhee. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lake Glenville, Wolf Mountain and Tuckasegee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
